story.storybody:
Xiaomi on Thursday announced its latest wearable Mi Band 2 in China. The band is successor to the Mi Band which was launched in late 2014. The Mi Band 2 has been launched at 149 Yuan, which roughly converts to Rs 1,500. However, there is no word on India launch as of yet.

Unlike the Mi Band, the latest wearable comes with an OLED display. The 0.42-inch display panel in scratch-proof and carries anti-fingerprint coating. The user can now check the steps count and heart rate from the display.

The Mi Band 2 houses a small metal button on one side of the display panel. The button can be used to toggle between different modes. The company has upgraded its pedometer software, which enables it to track steps and heart rate more accurately.

The fitness band also supports programmable alerts. This mean the Mi Band 2 can alert you for a phone call, or vibrate if you've been sitting for a long time.

The latest feature makes it an important upgrade compared to the 2014 Mi Band. The earlier Mi Band was limited in terms of functionality as it needed an associated app to check the data.

On the battery part, Xiaomi says the Mi Band 2 can last up to 20 days, which is impressive considering now it has a display. The original Mi Band could last more than 30 days on single charge.

Similar to its predecessor, the Mi Band 2 is also water, sweat and dust resistant.

The Mi Band 2 also comes with Bluetooth 4.0, which will help to maintain more stable connections with a smartphone. The company claims that it has used military-grade material to build the fitness band.

Despite the new features and revamped design, the Mi Band remains a fitness tracker. The company has so far stayed away from the smartwatch hype.
